riddles.question: Oh, you'll love this! I'm filled with keys but can't open a single door. I can produce melodies but can't sing a song. What am I, a magical creature from the land of impossibility?

image.alt: A dinosaur trying to open a door with a bunch of keys.

choices: A deranged locksmith
A haunted house
A piano out of tune
A disgruntled parrot with a penchant for jingles
riddles.hint: Think about something that can make a symphony, but can't voice out a single word.
riddles.correctFeedback: Bravo! You've hit the right note! It's a piano!
incorrectFeedback: Good try! But a locksmith would definitely open doors, wouldn't they?
Not quite! Haunted houses might have a spooky tune, but no keys!
Oh, nice attempt! But a parrot... even a disgruntled one, can't make a symphony!

correctAnswerImage.alt: A dinosaur playing a grand piano.

riddles.question: Here's a real humdinger for you! I'm always in front of you, but you'll never see me. Am I a ghost? A mirage? What am I?

image.alt: A unicorn looking into a mirror but seeing nothing.

choices: Your shy imaginary friend, Fred
The future, hiding behind the curtain of time
A very stealthy ninja
Your phone when it's on silent mode
riddles.hint: Think about something that's always ahead, but no crystal ball can show.
riddles.correctFeedback: Incredible! You've got it! It's the future!
incorrectFeedback: Haha! Fred might be shy, but I'm sure you'd see him if he existed!
Not quite! Even a ninja can't always hide in front of you!
Nope, your phone can be tricky but not this time!

correctAnswerImage.alt: A unicorn flipping a calendar page.

riddles.question: Here's something to tickle your brain! I'm full of holes, yet I'm full of water. Am I a leaky water balloon or what?

image.alt: A confused alien holding a leaky water balloon.

choices: A cloud with a bad case of the sniffles
A very sweaty cheese
A sponge on a mission to stay hydrated
A watering can with self-esteem issues
riddles.hint: Think about something that can absorb and hold water despite being full of holes.
riddles.correctFeedback: Spot on! It's a sponge. You soaked up that clue nicely!
incorrectFeedback: A cloud? Hmm, they do hold water, but they're not really full of holes.
A sweaty cheese? Too cheesy to hold water, I'm afraid!
A watering can? Well, it might be full of water, but it's not exactly full of holes!

correctAnswerImage.alt: An alien squeezing a sponge filled with water.

riddles.question: Alright, here's a quirky one! I can fly without wings, I can cry without eyes. Everywhere I go, darkness follows me. What am I, a superhero with a very specific set of powers?

image.alt: A superhero with wings and a giant pair of crying eyes.

choices: A misunderstood onion who dreams of being a bird
A rain cloud going through a goth phase
Your shadow on a very dramatic day
A cloud â€“ you know, the one where you store your data
riddles.hint: Think of something that's up in the sky, can 'cry', and can 'fly'.
riddles.correctFeedback: Absolutely correct! You've seen through the mist! It's a rain cloud!
incorrectFeedback: An onion? They might make you cry, but flying is not their forte!
Your shadow? Well, it does follow you, but the crying part is a bit of a stretch.
A data cloud? They might hold a lot of things, but flying and crying? Not so much!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The superhero holding an umbrella under a crying rain cloud.

riddles.question: Ok, here's a real puzzle for you! I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, rivers but no water. What am I, an eco-friendly model of Earth?

image.alt: A squirrel looking at a globe without any physical features.

choices: A very minimalist painting of the world
A map, but not the treasure kind
A very detailed doodle on your math homework
A dream about planet Mars, but with more greenery
riddles.hint: Think about something that can show all these features without actually having them.
riddles.correctFeedback: You've found your way! It's a map. You're a regular explorer!
incorrectFeedback: A minimalist painting? It might lack detail, but it's not quite right.
A doodle on your math homework? Well, that might be more fun, but it's not the answer here!
A dream about Mars? As green as it might be, it's not the answer we're looking for!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The squirrel holding a map, looking like a tiny explorer.

riddles.question: Think hard on this one! I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I, a puzzle piece with a life crisis?

image.alt: A puzzle piece pondering its life choices.

choices: A very versatile egg
A joke, but not the 'knock knock' kind
A piece of play-dough with an identity problem
An actor's script with dreams of stand-up comedy
riddles.hint: Think of something that can make you laugh. It's not a tickle!
riddles.correctFeedback: You're on a roll! It's a joke. You're no joke at this game!
incorrectFeedback: An egg? While they can be cracked and made, they're not so good at the 'told' and 'played' parts.
Play-dough? You can surely make it and play with it, but the 'cracked' and 'told' parts are not quite there.
An actor's script? It might be 'made', 'told', and 'played', but 'cracked'? I don't think so!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The puzzle piece laughing at a joke.

riddles.question: Alright, brace yourself! I'm always hungry and need to be fed, yet the more I eat, the thinner I get. What am I, a dieting black hole?

image.alt: A black hole reading a dieting book.

choices: A very dedicated caterpillar
Your dog when it's been three whole minutes since dinner
A pencil being put to good use
A calorie-burning app on your phone
riddles.hint: Think about something you use in school or for writing.
riddles.correctFeedback: Sharp answer! It's a pencil. You've got the 'write' stuff!
incorrectFeedback: A caterpillar? They do eat a lot, but the more they eat, the bigger they get, not thinner!
Your dog? They might act hungry all the time, but they definitely don't get thinner the more they eat!
A calorie-burning app? Well, it might help you get thinner, but it doesn't exactly eat!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The black hole sketching with a pencil.

riddles.question: Here's a mind-boggler! I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter, but can't go outside. What am I, a futuristic house?

image.alt: A futuristic house with a giant keyboard as a door.

choices: A keyboard, but not the piano kind
A house in a video game where the exit button is broken
A maze designed by a very mischievous mouse
A cryptic message from a locksmith
riddles.hint: Think about something you use with your computer.
riddles.correctFeedback: You've hit the right key! It's a keyboard. You're on a roll!
incorrectFeedback: A house in a video game? That's a fun idea, but it's not quite right.
A maze? While it can be tricky to exit, it doesn't exactly have keys.
A message from a locksmith? It might have keys, but what about the space without room?

correctAnswerImage.alt: The futuristic house turning into a giant keyboard.

riddles.question: Ok, here's a tricky one! The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I, a picky thief with a big heart?

image.alt: A picky thief leaving footprints as he walks away with a stolen heart.

choices: A generous millionaire who can't stop giving away money
Footprints, but not the 'in the sand' kind
A very confusing game of 'Take 5'
An eccentric artist who leaves paintings wherever he goes
riddles.hint: Think about something that gets left behind when you walk.
riddles.correctFeedback: You're leaving your mark! It's footprints. You're really stepping up your game!
incorrectFeedback: A generous millionaire? While they leave money behind, they don't leave more the more they take.
A game of 'Take 5'? It might be confusing, but it doesn't quite fit here.
An eccentric artist? That's an interesting idea, but it's not what we're looking for!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The picky thief looking surprised as he realizes he's left a trail of footprints.

riddles.question: Here's a puzzler for you! I can be written, I can be spoken, I can be exposed, I can be broken. What am I, a secret agent's diary?

image.alt: A secret agent's diary with a lock on it.

choices: A promise made on a pinky swear
News, but not the 'fake news' kind
A secret, but not the 'tell me a secret' kind
A record of a secret agent's failed diets
riddles.hint: Think about something you might keep to yourself or share with a friend.
riddles.correctFeedback: Your secret's safe with me! It's a secret. You're no secret to solving riddles!
incorrectFeedback: A promise? It can be made and broken, but it's not necessarily written or spoken.
News? While it can be written and spoken, it's not exactly 'exposed' or 'broken'.
A record of diets? While it can be written and possibly broken, it's not exactly 'exposed' or 'spoken'.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The secret agent's diary revealing a secret message.

riddles.question: Get ready for a conundrum! I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I, a ghost?

image.alt: A ghost floating in the wind.

choices: An echo, but not the 'hello, hello, hello' kind
A ventriloquist's dummy that's come to life
A whistle that only works on windy days
A sentient tornado with a knack for conversation
riddles.hint: Think about a sound that comes back to you.
riddles.correctFeedback: You're echoing the right answer! It's an echo. Keep these answers reverberating!
incorrectFeedback: A ventriloquist's dummy? While it might 'speak' without a mouth, it doesn't exactly 'hear' without ears.
A whistle? It might make a sound with wind, but it doesn't 'hear' or 'speak'.
A sentient tornado? That's an imaginative idea, but it's not what we're looking for!

correctAnswerImage.alt: The ghost turning into an echoing sound wave.

riddles.question: Put your thinking hat on! I come down but never go up. What am I, a clumsy elevator?

image.alt: An elevator with a 'down only' sign.

choices: Rain, but not the 'umbrella-needed' kind
A toy car that's lost its reverse gear
A staircase that only goes one way
A falling star that forgot how to rise
riddles.hint: Think about something that falls from the sky.
riddles.correctFeedback: You've poured out the right answer! It's rain. Your answers are pouring in!
incorrectFeedback: A toy car? It might only go one way, but it doesn't come down.
A one-way staircase? It might only go down, but it's not the answer we're looking for.
A falling star? It's a beautiful image, but it's not the answer.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The elevator turning into a rain cloud.

riddles.question: Strap on your thinking cap! I'm not alive, but I can grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I, a paradox?

image.alt: A paradoxical object floating in mid-air.

choices: Fire, but not the 'marshmallow-roasting' kind
A cactus that's afraid of water
A balloon that breathes air
A magic beanstalk that grows without life
riddles.hint: Think about something that needs air to exist but is extinguished by water.
riddles.correctFeedback: You're on fire with the right answer! It's fire. Keep these hot answers coming!
incorrectFeedback: A cactus? While it doesn't need much water, it's still alive and it doesn't need air.
A balloon? It might need air, but water doesn't kill it.
A magic beanstalk? It might grow without being alive in fairy tales, but it's not the answer here.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The paradoxical object turning into a flame.

riddles.question: Time for a brain teaser! I'm tall when I'm young and short when I'm old. What am I, a reverse growing beanstalk?

image.alt: A beanstalk shrinking into a bean.

choices: A candle, but not the 'birthday cake' kind
A giraffe that shrinks with age
A mountain that defies geological time
An aging skyscraper with floor issues
riddles.hint: Think about something that gets smaller as it's used.
riddles.correctFeedback: You've lit up the right answer! It's a candle. Your answers are burning bright!
incorrectFeedback: A shrinking giraffe? Although it's a funny image, giraffes don't shrink as they get older.
A mountain? While erosion might make it smaller over time, it's not the answer here.
An aging skyscraper? While a skyscraper might 'age', it doesn't physically get shorter.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The shrinking beanstalk turning into a melting candle.

riddles.question: Alright, gumshoe! The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. What am I, a bizarre reverse thief?

image.alt: A cartoon thief leaving a trail of footprints.

choices: Footsteps, but not the 'tiptoeing' kind
A time-traveling reverse pickpocket
A generous baker with endless cookies
A trail of breadcrumbs from an overly cautious hiker
riddles.hint: Think about something you leave behind as you move.
riddles.correctFeedback: You've stepped to the right answer! It's footsteps. Keep moving forward with these answers!
incorrectFeedback: A time-traveling reverse pickpocket? While it's an interesting concept, it's not the answer.
A generous baker? While they might leave a trail of cookies, it's not the answer here.
A trail of breadcrumbs? While it's left behind as you move, it's not the answer.

correctAnswerImage.alt: The cartoon thief's footprints turning into a trail of footprints.

riddles.question: Brace yourself for this one! I'm a celestial body, but I'm not always in the sky. During the day, you can't see me, but at night, I'm your best buddy. I've been accused of changing shapes, but honestly, I'm just going through phases. What am I?
choices: A very confused cloud with an identity crisis
An emotional rainbow trying to find itself
The Moon that's just trying to live its life
A star with a flare for the dramatic
riddles.hint: I'm not a star, but I shine at night. I'm also not a cloud, and rainbows are out of the question.
riddles.correctFeedback: Bravo! You got it! It's the Moon, our friendly neighbor in the night sky. And don't worry, it's not having an identity crisis, just going through its phases!
incorrectFeedback: Ha! A cloud with an identity crisis? Not quite, but that's a funny idea.
An emotional rainbow? That's a colorful guess, but no.
A dramatic star? Nope, but that would make a great movie character.

riddles.question: Get ready for a wild ride! I'm a kind of king, but I don't wear a crown. I do my best work when I'm spinning, but I'm not a dancer. If you scratch me, it's not a big deal... unless you're a DJ! What am I?
choices: A very dizzy giraffe who thinks he's royalty
A squirrel with a penchant for ballet
A vinyl record that just loves to groove
A skating penguin with an overactive imagination
riddles.hint: Think about something that spins and creates music, but isn't alive.
riddles.correctFeedback: You're on the right track! It's a vinyl record. DJs love to scratch them, but only in a cool DJ way!
incorrectFeedback: A dizzy giraffe who thinks he's royalty? Hilarious, but no.
A ballet-loving squirrel? Cute, but not the answer.
A skating penguin with an overactive imagination? That's just adorable, but no.

riddles.question: Oh Sherlock, get ready for this one! I'm the heart of the home, yet I'm as cold as ice. I can hold a pizza party inside me, but I don't like to party myself. Who am I?

image.alt: Cartoon image of a shivering kitchen

choices: An introverted disco ball in the attic.
A refrigerator, the chilliest member of the kitchen.
The super cool couch in the living room.
A chilly chihuahua who's eaten too much pizza.
riddles.hint: I'm in the kitchen, and I like to keep things cool!
riddles.correctFeedback: Freeze frame! You got it! It's the refrigerator, always ready for a pizza party.
incorrectFeedback: Nope, a disco ball is cool, but not in the right way.
Don't make the couch shiver, it's not the right answer!
A chilly chihuahua? No, but that's an amusing image!

correctAnswerImage.alt: Cool refrigerator with a party hat

riddles.question: Hey, riddle aficionado! I'm famous, I'm fictional, and I've got a big, bad problem with a certain color. Who am I?

image.alt: Fictional character looking at a paint color swatch in frustration

choices: Captain America, who has had it with the color red.
Superman, who simply cannot stand the color green.
Batman, who's had enough of the color black.
Spiderman, who's tangled up in his dislike of blue.
riddles.hint: This character is 'super', but there's a certain color that's his 'kryptonite'.
riddles.correctFeedback: You're super too! It's Superman, who really isn't fond of green (especially kryptonite green).
incorrectFeedback: Captain America, red? No, that's not it.
Batman, enough of black? Nope, he loves his dark hues!
Spiderman tangled up in blue? No, but nice guess!
